meanings.definition: A person or thing that is remarkable or excellent.
meanings.sent1: My friend Sarah is one of those dillies who always brightens up the room.
meanings.sent2: The new movie we watched last night was a real dillies!
meanings.sent3: The little puppy thought he was a dillies when he managed to catch his tail.
meanings.sent4: Her singing voice was a dillies, filling the whole auditorium with joy.
meanings.sent5: The sunset over the ocean was an absolute dillies, painting the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.sent1: Don't be a dillies and try to juggle those fragile vases.
meanings.sent2: The class clown was known for his antics and being a dillies.
meanings.sent3: The dillies in the story always made everyone laugh with their silly jokes.
meanings.sent4: He acted like a dillies, not taking anything seriously.
meanings.sent5: She felt like a dillies when she realized she had been wearing mismatched shoes all day.

meanings.definition: A small, decorative ornament or trinket.
meanings.sent1: She wore a beautiful necklace adorned with delicate dillies.
meanings.sent2: The antique shop was filled with all sorts of unique dillies.
meanings.sent3: The dillies on the keychain sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The room was decorated with colorful dillies hanging from the ceiling.
meanings.sent5: The Christmas tree was covered in shiny dillies and lights, creating a festive atmosphere.
